questions.question: She has moved to England ……………………… she can perfect her English.
questions.description: So that is a conjunction used to express purpose. It goes before a clause.

questions.question: We send monthly reports ……………………… parents can assess the progress of their children.
questions.description: So that is a conjunction used to express purpose. It goes before a clause.

questions.question: He came to Mumbai ……………………… for work.
questions.description: We use the infinitive to express a person’s purpose.

questions.question: I went to Canada ………………………… my brother.
questions.description: We use the infinitive to express a person’s purpose.

questions.question: Send the parcel express ………………………… they will get it before Saturday.
questions.description: So that is a conjunction used to express purpose. It goes before a clause.

questions.question: I went to the college ……………………….. an interview with my professor.
questions.description: We use for to talk about somebody’s purpose in doing something.

questions.question: A barometer is used ………………………. height above sea level.
questions.description: We can use for to express the purpose of a thing especially when that thing is the subject of the clause.

questions.question: We use a thermometer ………………………. temperature.
questions.description: When the clause has a person as subject, we use an infinitive to express the purpose of a thing.

questions.question: Let’s have a short break ……………………. lunch.
questions.description: For is a preposition indicating purpose. It goes before a noun.

questions.question: Is there anything that I need to get ……………………….. the party?
We left early …………………………… we wouldn’t get stuck in the traffic.
questions.description: So that is a conjunction used to express purpose. It goes before a clause.

questions.question: I worked hard ……………………….. I might pass the test.
questions.description: The conjunctions so that and in order that are both used to express purpose.
